{"url": "https://www.windowslatest.com/2024/07/18/windows-11-is-nagging-users-to-try-onedrive-to-fully-backup-your-pc/", "title": "Windows 11 is nagging users to try OneDrive to \"fully backup\" your PC", "body": "Windows 11 and Windows 10 were recently updated with \"Windows Backup\", which has now become a system app. While the feature initially appeared as \"optional\" or something that could be easily dismissed, Microsoft is slowly getting aggressive with its new OneDrive backup campaign on Windows 11.\n\nWindows 11's \"Windows Backup\" uses OneDrive to back up many of the things that are important to you. This may include your credentials, settings, pictures, documents, videos, files, themes, or even audio settings. Microsoft wants the Windows Backup app to become the ultimate backup tool, but there's a catch.\n\nWindows Backup does not support offline backups and requires a OneDrive plan. By default, OneDrive offers 5GB of free storage, which is why some users do not want to backup their PC. But is that going to stop Microsoft from pestering users? Probably not. In a new server-side update, Windows 11 has started nagging users to try the Backup tool.\n\nAs shown in the above screenshot spotted by Windows Latest, there is a notification from \"Windows Backup\" that says: \"Your PC is not fully backed up. Backup is not turned on for Credentials and Folders. Back up now to save them if something happens to your PC.\"\n\nThere are two buttons below this message: \"Back up now\" and \"Dismiss.\"\n\nIf you select \"Back up now\", it will turn on Windows Backup settings and automatically begin synching your data to OneDrive, which has a cap limit of 5G if you're on the free plan. Or you can click \"Dismiss\", which dismisses the notification for a few weeks.\n\nIt is worth noting that the pop-up alert could reappear if you turn off settings. For example, if you turn off backup for 'credentials', such as your Wi-Fi passwords, the pop-up will reappear.\n\nThat's because Microsoft wants you to use OneDrive-powered Windows Backup to fully back up your PC.\n\nIn a support document, Microsoft says \"Windows Backup app is focused on consumer devices\". In other words, while you may see the app quietly hidden somewhere in Windows 11 if you've a work account, Windows Backup will not work. It works with live.com, outlook.com and similar personal accounts.\n\nIn our tests, Windows Latest observed that Windows Backup is a fine tool that gets the job done. It's similar to Apple's iCloud sync or Google Drive sync. Like every other cloud storage, OneDrive is not free, so you'll need to subscribe to the most basic plan, which starts at $1.99 per month or $19.99 per year with up to 100 GB of cloud storage.\n\nThere's nothing wrong with Windows Backup relying on OneDrive, which is a paid service.\n\nBut what if you don't want to use Windows Backup or OneDrive? Unfortunately, you cannot completely remove these alerts from Windows 11.", "source": {"uri": "windowslatest.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Windows Latest"}, "authors": [{"uri": "mayank_parmar@windowslatest.com", "name": "Mayank Parmar", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}], "image": "https://www.windowslatest.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Windows-11-OneDrive-upsell.jpg", "eventUri": "eng-9736998", "sentiment": -0.003921568627450966, "wgt": 459008611, "relevance": 50}
{"url": "https://www.accesswire.com/889619/airdroid-business-expands-capabilities-with-windows-device-management", "title": "AirDroid Business Expands Capabilities With Windows Device Management", "body": "AirDroid Business device management now supports Windows system devices to boost enterprise efficiency\n\nSINGAPORE / ACCESSWIRE / July 18, 2024 / AirDroid Business is excited to announce that its device management solution now fully supports Windows devices. This significant update provides enterprises with enhanced capabilities for bulk device deployment & configuration, policy & kiosk management, application management.\n\n\"Modern organizations rely heavily on endpoints, and as the number of Windows devices accessing corporate networks from our customers increases, it has become increasingly challenging for IT teams to manage and secure them effectively,\" said Jack Guo, CTO at AirDroid Business. \"We've designed our solution to reduce the number of tools businesses need and simplify their tech stack. IT teams need a comprehensive endpoint management solution that unifies every device to keep employees productive and minimize risk.\"\n\nPolicy management, which includes application blacklists and whitelists, password restrictions, device usage limits, browser configurations and more, has been significantly enhanced, enabling businesses to enforce and customize policies across Windows devices from a single dashboard. This ensures all devices comply with company standards and security protocols, reducing the risk of unauthorized access and data breaches. IT admins can tailor policies to fit specific business needs, ensuring each device operates within desired parameters while implementing stringent security measures to protect sensitive data and provent unauthorized device access.\n\nAirDroid Business now includes Kiosk Mode for Windows devices, allowing businesses to lock down devices to a single application or a specific set of applications. This feature is particularly useful for environments like retail, hospitality, and education, where a controlled and secure user experience is paramount. Kiosk Mode ensures that devices are used solely for their intended purpose, enhancing security and reducing the risk of unauthorized use.\n\nThe update includes robust application management tools, enabling businesses to manage and distribute apps across Windows devices effectively. This ensures productivity by keeping necessary applications available and up-to-date. Key benefits are efficient app distribution for quick deployment and updates, version control to prevent compatibility issues, and remote installation and updates to minimize downtime and reduce physical access needs.\n\nAirDroid Business remains committed to providing comprehensive device management solutions that cater to the evolving needs of enterprises. By extending support to Windows devices, AirDroid Business continues to empower businesses with the tools they need to manage their device ecosystems efficiently and securely. This update underscores AirDroid Business's dedication to innovation and excellence in the realm of device management.\n\nFor more information about AirDroid Business and its new features, please visit www.airdroid.com/business.\n\nAbout AirDroid Business\n\nAirDroid Business, launched in 2018 by Sand Studio, is an enterprise-grade device management solution for attended and unattended Android & Windows devices. It is designed to improve the mobility and productivity of businesses of all sizes through remote access and control, device provisioning, policy application and management, kiosk mode, geofencing, and more.", "source": {"uri": "accesswire.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Investing News Network"}, "authors": [], "image": "https://storage.googleapis.com/accesswire/logos/subaccounts/share/36720.png", "eventUri": null, "sentiment": 0.3725490196078431, "wgt": 459008605, "relevance": 50}

{"url": "https://economy.okezone.com/read/2024/07/18/320/3036268/10-situs-penghasil-uang-tanpa-modal", "title": "10 Situs Penghasil Uang Tanpa Modal : Okezone Economy", "body": "JAKARTA- 10 Situs penghasil uang tanpa modal. Di era sekarang yang serba canggih, hal ini memungkin untuk menghasilkan uang dari rumah tanpa perlu menggunakan modal.\n\nMengutip berbagai sumber, Kamis (18/7/2024), berikut 10 situs penghasil uang tanpa modal:\n\n1. Shutterstock\n\nSitus ini memungkinkan untuk menjual foto dan mendapatkan komisi dari setiap penjualan, Shutterstock ini tersedia di berbagai platform seperti Android, iOS, Windows dan Mac\n\n2. Streetbees\n\nStreetbees adalah aplikasi penghasil uang yang paling unik. Cara mendapatkan uang dari aplikasi ini adalah dengan kita membagikan aktivitas atau hobi kita seperti berolahraga, memasak, bermain musik atau lain sebagainya. Dengan membagikan story tersebut, nantinya kamu akan medapatkan uang.\n\nBACA JUGA: 5 Aplikasi Penghasil Uang yang Viral 2024\n\n3. Jadi Duit\n\nAplikasi penghasil uang tanpa modal ini terbukti nyata. Anda harus menyelesaikan misi harian agar memperoleh saldo. Lalu, saldo tersebut dapat Anda tarik melalui rekening.\n\n4. Rev\n\nSitus yang menawarkan pekerjaan transkripsi, subtitling, dan captioning. Memeungkinkan menghasilkan uang setiap minggu. Dan ini adalah salah satu pekerjaan transkripsi jarak jauh paling populer di pasaran.\n\n5. Easy Buck\n\nAplikasi yang mudah untuk penggunanya. Hanya peril menyelesaikan game dan mengisi survie untuk mendapatkan hadiah.\n\nBACA JUGA: 5 Aplikasi Penghasil Uang Asli Terbukti Membayar Langsung ke DANA Tanpa Iklan\n\n6. Survey Time\n\nDapat menghasilkan uang untuk para penggunanya, setelah mengerjakan survey online, pengguna bisa langsung mendapatkan hadiah di setiap survey. Surveytime berkerja sama dengan berbagai imstitusi penelitian pasa terbesar didunia, sehingga pengguna dapat membagian pendapat mereka dan mendapatkan pembayaran.\n\nFollow Berita Okezone di Google News\n\nDapatkan berita up to date dengan semua berita terkini dari Okezone hanya dengan satu akun di ORION, daftar sekarang dengan klik disini dan nantikan kejutan menarik lainnya\n\n7. Swagbucks\n\nDapat menghasilkan uang dengan menjalankan misi seperti mengisi survey online bermain game, ataupun menonton video. Setelah melakukan hal tersebut, pengguna akan memperoleh giftcard yang bisa dicairkan melalui Paypal atau e-wallet lainnya.\n\n8. Macha\n\nPenghasil uang yang daoat melatih kemampuan matematika. Setelah mengerjakan game di situs ini pengguna akan mendapatkan bonus berupa saldo dan pulsa. Kemudian saldo yang dikumpulkan bisa ditukar menjadi uang.\n\n9. Mobile Premier League (MPL)\n\nMerupakan aplikasi untuk para pencita eSport khusu nya game. Mereka menawarkan kurang lebih 20 game yang menarik untuk mendapatkan uang\n\n10. Poll Pay\n\nSeperti aplikasi survei online pada umumnya dengan mengikuti arahan dan mengisi survei pengguna dapat mendapatkan saldo, saldo yang telah terkumpul akan ditukar kan uang atau hadiah lainnya.\n\n10 Situs penghasil uang tanpa modal semua situs di atas menawarkan pelung untuk mendapatkan uang tanpa modal dengan melakukan survei, bermain game ataupun menjual karya digital seperti foto dll.\n\nSebelumnya 1 2 Selanjutnya Follow WhatsApp Channel Okezone untuk update berita terbaru setiap hari Follow #situs cuan #Situs Penghasil Uang #Situs #penghasil uang", "source": {"uri": "economy.okezone.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "https://economy.okezone.com/"}, "authors": [], "image": "https://img.okezone.com/content/2024/07/18/320/3036268/10-situs-penghasil-uang-tanpa-modal-qsIYyOtGkt.png", "eventUri": null, "sentiment": null, "wgt": 459008036, "relevance": 26}

{"url": "https://www.osnews.com/story/140258/unified-kernel-image/", "title": "Unified kernel image", "body": "UKIs can run on UEFI systems and simplify the distribution of small kernel images. For example, they simplify network booting with iPXE. UKIs make rootfs and kernels composable, making it possible to derive a rootfs for multiple kernel versions with one file for each pair.\n\nA Unified Kernel Image (UKI) is a combination of a UEFI boot stub program, a Linux kernel image, an initramfs, and further resources in a single UEFI PE file (device tree, cpu Âµcode, splash screen, secure boot sig/key, ...). This file can either be directly invoked by the UEFI firmware or through a boot loader.\n\nâ†« Hugues\n\nIf you're still a bit unfamiliar with unified kernel images, this post contains a ton of detailed practical information. Unified kernel images might become a staple for forward-looking Linux distributions, and I know for a fact that my distribution of choice, Fedora, has been working on it for a while now. The goal is to eventually simplify the boot process as a whole, and make better, more optimal use of the advanced capabilities UEFI gives us over the old, limited, 1980s BIOS model.\n\nLike I said a few posts ago, I really don't want to be using traditional bootloaders anymore. UEFI is explicitly designed to just boot operating systems on its own, and modern PCs just don't need bootloaders anymore. They're points of failure users shouldn't be dealing with anymore in 2024, and I'm glad to see the Linux world is seriously moving towards negating the need for their existence.", "source": {"uri": "osnews.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "OSNews: Exploring the Future of Computing"}, "authors": [{"uri": "thom_holwerda@osnews.com", "name": "Thom Holwerda", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}], "image": null, "eventUri": null, "sentiment": 0.2313725490196079, "wgt": 459007860, "relevance": 1}
{"url": "https://www.pcmag.com/news/external-hard-drives-ssds-prime-day-deals-2024", "title": "Last Chance: The Best Amazon Prime Day Deals on Hard Drives and SSDs", "body": "I have been a technology journalist for almost 30 years and have covered just about every kind of computer gear -- from the 386SX to 64-core processors -- in my long tenure as an editor, a writer, and an advice columnist. For almost a quarter-century, I worked on the seminal, gigantic Computer Shopper magazine (and later, its digital counterpart), aka the phone book for PC buyers, and the nemesis of every postal delivery person. I was Computer Shopper's editor in chief for its final nine years, after which much of its digital content was folded into PCMag.com. I also served, briefly, as the editor in chief of the well-known hardcore tech site Tom's Hardware.\n\nBuying the best-value external hard drive or SSD is, strictly speaking, a numbers game. The biggest numbers in play? The first is the price you pay on any given day for the drive you're considering. Even with Amazon Prime Day 2024 officially over, it's still one of the best times of the summer, let alone the year, to make your move.\n\nThe second number to look out for is the capacity of the drive, in gigabytes. Simple math will tell you how much you're paying per gigabyte, which is an excellent yardstick for measuring whether a drive is a scorcher of a deal or a just \"meh\" one.\n\nThose are not the only numbers to know, though. Also look at the length of the warranty for any drive you're eyeing. Plus -- and here's where yours truly, the PCMag experts, come in -- check out formal speed-test numbers from reputable third-party review sites. We'll toot our horn: We test dozens of external drives every year, both classic platter-based hard drives and speedy, compact solid-state models. A low cost per gigabyte, plus a warranty plan you can live with and a speed rating high enough for the kinds of stuff you store, together add up to the right external drive for your laptop or desktop.\n\nDeals on external storage move whip-fast in and out of \"good deal\" and \"great deal\" territory -- the very best ones don't stick around for long. That's because everybody loves more gigabytes. Here are some of the best deals we've seen for Prime Day on the top drives we've tested. (Looking for something more fun than storage and backup? We've got plenty of other excellent tech deals you can still grab after Prime Day ends.)\n\nSuperbly suited for pro content creators and mainstream users alike, the Samsung SSD Portable T9 is not only a Prime Day deal, but it's a great external SSD at any price. With the T9, you can expect 10Gbps speeds with the USB-C ports on most laptops and desktops. And if you're fortunate enough to have a USB-C port that supports USB 3.2 Gen 2x2, you could see up to double that. The drive comes in capacities up to 4TB, and it supports 256-bit AES hardware-based encryption in the event it falls into the wrong hands. It's also drop-proof and equipped with Samsung's polished, handy Magician software utility. (See our review of the Samsung Portable SSD T9.)\n\nHere's one for the Apple crowd. (It comes formatted for Macs, though you can use it with Windows, too.) We reviewed the 2TB version of the ArmorATD a few years back, and liked it. Prime Day sees a sale on the 5TB version, which is roomy for a portable hard drive. (It's also a lot cheaper than a 4TB or 8TB external SSD!) Hard drives are sensitive to drops and jolts, so opting for a model with a ruggedized frame or bumper like this one has is wise if you tend to use your drive in situations where rough handling is a possibility. You'll still want to treat it carefully, but the ArmorATD is tougher than most platter-based units. (See our review of the SanDisk Professional G-Drive Armor ATD.)\n\nPortable hard drives based on 2.5-inch internal platter mechanisms just recently hit a peak capacity of 6TB, so this deal on a 5TB model is for the kind of drive that, until not that long ago, was the roomiest around. We gave the My Passport 5TB an Editors' Choice award, in its time, for its then-top capacity and lightweight design. WD's supporting software is also a plus, and SSDs just can't touch this drive's cost per gigabyte of less than 3 cents. (See our review of the WD My Passport 5TB.)\n\nYou need to go all in on the T7 Shield only if you'll be taking your SSD places where most tech fears to tread. This drive has a rubbery wrapper that keeps it safe in the event of tumbles, rain, and other environmental invaders. Indeed, the T7 Shield is rated for dust- and water-resistance that should suffice for most casual (or should we say careless?) use. On-the-go photographers, field workers, and hopeless klutzes will want to give this tough drive a strong second look. It's a little costlier per gig than your typical external SSD, but if you can't put a value on your data, it's a bargain at any price -- and especially at this one. (See our review of the Samsung Portable SSD T7 Shield.)\n\nThe Two Main Kinds of Drive: HDDs and SSDs\n\nExternal drives for consumers that you'll see on Prime Day are split into two broad categories: external SSDs (which have no moving parts), and external platter hard drives (based on spinning mechanical disks). Within the hard drive class are portable USB-powered drives, as well as larger, AC-powered (but still USB-connected) desktop models. Portable hard drives are built around the 2.5-inch drive mechanisms that once were common in laptops, and these top out at 5TB or 6TB. Desktop drives employ meatier, but roomier, 3.5-inch mechanisms; most of these nowadays start at 8TB. When choosing between desktop and portable drives, consider whether you'll have your drive sit in one place all the time, or if it needs to come with you on the road (or even just around the house).\n\nMost mainstream external drives rely on the USB interface, in one of its myriad flavors. The drive may have a USB-A or USB-C connector at the computer end; many now come with both types of cables, or with an adapter. The nomenclature and nuances around USB speed specs are fussy stuff, so the best advice: Match the specific USB spec that the drive supports (say, \"USB 3.2 Gen 2\") with that of the fastest USB port on your PC or Mac. A few, usually pricey-per-gig, models employ the Thunderbolt 3 or 4 interface. These mostly target Mac users.", "source": {"uri": "pcmag.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "PC Magazine"}, "authors": [{"uri": "john_burek@pcmag.com", "name": "John Burek", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}], "image": "https://i.pcmag.com/imagery/articles/00IccN3FJwXEtIOtE6sunTq-1.fit_lim.size_1200x630.v1721250415.jpg", "eventUri": "eng-9737978", "sentiment": 0.1686274509803922, "wgt": 459007775, "relevance": 13}

{"url": "https://www.xatakandroid.com/tutoriales/pulsar-boton-tener-ram-posible-tu-movil-xiaomi-este-truco-hyperos", "title": "Pulsar un botÃ³n y tener mÃ¡s RAM es posible en tu mÃ³vil Xiaomi con este truco de HyperOS", "body": "Mi primer mÃ³vil Android tenÃ­a 512 MB de RAM y llegÃ³ un punto en que cada vez que abrÃ­a WhatsApp tenÃ­a que forzar el cierre del resto de apps. Hoy en dÃ­a los mÃ³viles tienen mucha mÃ¡s RAM pero hay veces en las que no puede ser suficiente. Si tienes un mÃ³vil Xiaomi, Redmi o POCO con HyperOS, puedes aumentar RAM en un par de segundos.\n\nNo necesitas desatornillar el mÃ³vil ni hacer nada, salvo aprovechar una funciÃ³n de HyperOS que es bastante habitual hoy en dÃ­a en muchos mÃ³viles: la memoria virtual. HyperOS (y antiguamente MIUI) llama a esto extensiÃ³n de memoria.\n\nLos mÃ³viles tienen cada vez mÃ¡s RAM pero tambiÃ©n hay aplicaciones y juegos que requieren de mÃ¡s RAM. Una posible soluciÃ³n o, al menos un parche para salir del paso, es usar la memoria virtual. Esto significa que parte del almacenamiento de tu mÃ³vil se usa como memoria RAM, de forma similar a como pasa en Windows.\n\nLa memoria RAM es volÃ¡til: se usa temporalmente para almacenar los datos de las aplicaciones que se usan. Android se encarga de gestionar y reciclar esta memoria para que rara vez nos quedemos sin memoria. En el caso de que nos quedemos sin memoria, Android se encarga de cerrar aplicaciones en segundo plano para hacer espacio.\n\nPuede haber casos en los que la memoria de tu mÃ³vil se quede corta. Especialmente si juegas a juegos AAA que consumen muchos recursos en el mÃ³vil y tu mÃ³vil tiene \"solo\" 3, 4 o 6 GB de RAM. En ese caso las capas de Android como HyperOS te permiten usar almacenamiento interno como RAM. Pierdes almacenamiento, ganas en RAM.\n\nLa RAM virtual nos ayuda a que Android tenga disponible mÃ¡s memoria y potencialmente pueda cerrar las aplicaciones de forma menos agresiva (otra cosa es que lo siga haciendo por ahorrar baterÃ­a), pero no es igual de rÃ¡pida que la real. No obstante, el sistema es lo suficientemente inteligente para usar primero con la memoria RAM real antes de usar la virtual, asÃ­ que activar la memoria virtual no tiene ningÃºn inconveniente mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de que pierdes espacio de almacenamiento.\n\nEl mayor impedimento es que puede ser difÃ­cil encontrar cÃ³mo se hace esto en HyperOS en tu mÃ³vil Xiaomi, POCO o Redmi, pues estÃ¡ un poco escondido. Los pasos son los siguientes:\n\nY ya estÃ¡, tu mÃ³vil de 4 GB ahora puede tener por ejemplo unos 6 GB de memoria, 4 reales y 2 virtuales. Si abres un juego que se coma los 4 GB de RAM de un plumazo, todavÃ­a tendrÃ¡s un extra de memoria adicional para cambiar a otras aplicaciones en mitad del juego sin que se abran de cero cada vez.\n\nImagen de portada | Generada con IA", "source": {"uri": "xatakandroid.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Xataka Android"}, "authors": [], "image": "https://i.blogs.es/166fb5/memorias/1366_521.jpeg", "eventUri": null, "sentiment": null, "wgt": 459007724, "relevance": 13}
{"url": "https://www.pcmag.com/how-to/what-to-do-if-your-headphones-or-speakers-sound-terrible", "title": "What to Do If Your Headphones or Speakers Sound Terrible", "body": "There's no feeling like turning on your new high-end computer speakers or noise-cancelling headphones, only to hear crackling static instead of crisp music. However, before blaming your audio peripherals for the garbled mess in your ears, it might also be the computer or phone that's to blame. If your audio has a bad case of the snap-crackle-pops, here are a few ways to troubleshoot the problem.\n\n1. Lower the Volume\n\nYou might want to enjoy your new speaker, but if it distorts at loud volumes, it might just not have enough power for the space. Turn the volume down and see if the music still sounds distorted. If it sounds okay, your speaker is probably just underpowered for that volume level.\n\n2. Check Your Source Files\n\nNext, check the quality of the music itself. For streaming services like Spotify, make sure you have the audio-quality setting as high as it goes for the best sounding music. For lossless audio, Apple Music and Tidal are your best options, while Amazon Music Ultimate costs extra for better music quality.\n\nIf you're trying to play music that you own, remember to only grab songs from trusted sources. For those with a large CD collection, rip the disc and go digital. If it's music bought from iTunes or Amazon, you can be reasonably assured the songs are a decent quality.\n\nHowever, if you're listening to an 80kbps MP3 downloaded from KaZaA in the early 2000s -- or worse, streaming a YouTube video of a song someone else downloaded from KaZaA in the early 2000s -- there are no settings you can tweak to make it sound good.\n\n3. Look for Dirt or Water Damage\n\nIf your problems seem tied to one specific speaker or set of headphones, it could have water damage, dirt, or other debris keeping the speaker from producing clear audio. This is especially common in the built-in speakers on smartphones, so grab a toothpick and clean out any gunk you see. Those with AirPods can follow our cleaning guide.\n\nIf your iPhone recently took a dip in the pool, there's an Apple Shortcut that can help get the water out. Otherwise, just give the phone time to dry. However, keep in mind that nothing lasts forever. A modern smartphone can survive a splashing -- or even a dunking -- but dropping it into the ocean is another story. Waterproof headphones do exist, but you'll probably need to buy a new pair if they go through the wash.\n\n4. Try a Different Port (If You Can)\n\nIf you use Bluetooth headphones, try a wired pair or use the cable that came with them, if they support both. If you have wired headphones, try with a Bluetooth pair if one is available. This will help determine if the issue is with Bluetooth, the cable, or the headphones themselves.\n\nDesktop PCs are not usually known for having the best audio quality on the front headphone jack. (That's why many audiophiles use DACs, separate digital-to-analog converters.) If things sound less than stellar, try plugging the headphones into the speaker jack on the back of your PC to see if that improves anything.\n\nLaptops won't have another headphone jack (or any at all), but you could try connecting them with a USB dongle to see if you notice any differences. Depending on the computer model, you may need a 3.5mm-to-USB-C or 3.5mm-to-USB-A adapter.\n\nThe problem could also be with the jack itself, or with the audio drivers governing the PC's onboard audio. If it's the latter case, try reinstalling the drivers to see if that helps.\n\n5. Disable Phone Calls on Your Headphones\n\nLet's assume everything is good on the hardware side: Now it's time to dig into the audio settings. If your earbuds double as a headset for phone calls, it's possible the device is sending audio using the inferior phone call path rather than treating them as high-quality stereo headphones.\n\nIn Windows 10, open Settings > Sound > Sound Control Panel to see a list of all the speakers, headphones, and unused audio ports on your machine. Those with Windows 11 should go to Settings > System > Sound > More sound settings. Look for the device with a green checkmark -- the one you're currently using -- and make sure it's the correct one.\n\nIf you have a set of wireless headphones with a built-in microphone, it may produce two entries in this list -- one as a stereo set of headphones, and one as a hands-free headset designed for phone calls. If you play music through the virtual device designed for phone calls, it will sound terrible, so select different items here and click Set Default to see if one option sounds better than another. (You can also disable the communications headset option completely.)\n\nThis is a common issue on Windows machines, but less so on phones. Still, it doesn't hurt to check. On Android, go into the Bluetooth settings, tap the settings cog next to the headphones in question, and turn calls off to see if that solves the problem. On an iPhone, click the \"i\" next to your headphones in Bluetooth settings and change the Device type to see if that does anything.\n\n6. Adjust Your Equalizer and Audio Enhancements\n\nMany phones and PCs have some audio \"enhancements\" that can be added to your music, though these can often do more harm than good. If you're hearing distortion, make sure all of these settings are turned off. In Windows, head back to the Sound Settings as described above. Then, right-click the device from the list and click the Properties button\n\nGo through any Enhancements, Advanced, or Spatial Sound tabs you see to turn off features like Spatial Sound or Bass Boost. All of these things can, in theory, cause distortion in the audio. You might even try turning Exclusive Mode on or off, to see if that solves any issues.\n\nIf your problems are on an iPhone, head to Settings > Music and make sure the EQ is turned off. Do the same for the music app you're using to listen. Android users will need to turn to their specific music app of choice, though Samsung devices may have other audio enhancements in settings. Search for features like Dolby Atmos, Equalizers, Adapt Sound, and other improvements that could be causing problems.\n\nYou may also want to change the audio codec used for Bluetooth devices. iPhone owners should be using headphones that support AAC, while Android users should use AptX. In Android, open Bluetooth settings, click the cog next to your headphones, and try the higher-quality AAC or aptX instead of the default setting, if given the option. On some phones, this will be called \"HD Audio.\"\n\n7. Disconnect Other Bluetooth Devices\n\nHow many Bluetooth devices have you connected to your phone? Are your headphones paired to your phone and computer at the same time? Sometimes, Bluetooth devices can interfere with one another, which will make music sound distorted, especially if audio is coming from multiple sources.\n\nCheck the Bluetooth settings on your computer or phone and disconnect any secondary devices that may have automatically connected. After clearing things out, your audio may come in cleaner in your main Bluetooth headphones. (For a smartwatch, you might be able to go into the watch's settings and turn off call and media audio.)", "source": {"uri": "pcmag.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "PC Magazine"}, "authors": [{"uri": "whitson_gordon@pcmag.com", "name": "Whitson Gordon", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}], "image": "https://i.pcmag.com/imagery/articles/02UfFCtQzI7hfixDyfjr2mV-9.fit_lim.size_1200x630.v1619030735.jpg", "eventUri": null, "sentiment": -0.2235294117647059, "wgt": 459007633, "relevance": 13}

{"url": "https://www.techradar.com/computing/windows/windows-11-22h2-gets-one-final-push-by-microsoft-before-retirement-but-23h2-is-here-for-the-rescue", "title": "Windows 11 22H2 gets one final push by Microsoft before retirement - but 23H2 is here for the rescue", "body": "Windows 11 version 22H2 is finally available to download and install for all eligible Windows 11 users as of July 17, 2024 - just a few months before it's getting ditched by Microsoft. This final push might seem a little late in the day considering 22H2 is nearing its end of life date, and Microsoft is trying to encourage people to get the more recent Windows 11 23H2 update instead.\n\nNot only has it been nearly a year since 23H2's initial release, but Windows 11 22H2's end-of-support date is also quickly approaching. This isn't unusual, as every Windows product released has a product lifecycle, which is essentially a plan for the product's development, implementation, and, ultimately, its deprecation. 22H2's end-of-support date is set for October 8, 2024, and Microsoft will supposedly stop releasing monthly security patch updates for it after this date.\n\nMonthly security patches are important as both the tech companies that release them and industry experts recommend that you install them as soon as they're available as they contain protective measures to help secure your PC against newly devised attacks and address freshly discovered vulnerabilities. When Microsoft stops releasing these, any devices running 22H2 will be left at risk.\n\nFor this reason, devices running Windows 11 Home and Pro will be forced to update to 23H2 (unless they are managed by IT departments of organizations - then they might be exempt). After this happens, these devices will be eligible to receive the latest security patches for 23H2.\n\nWindows 11 23H2 is slated for an end-of-support date of November 11, 2025, and when compared to its predecessor 22H2, it also brings changes including taskbar regrouping that enables users to see each new app window as a separate icon, a new volume mixer which allows users to control the volume of various apps and playback devices more easily, and native 7Z and RAR file format support.\n\nThe broader availability of 22H2 was announced and further detailed on Microsoft's Learn blog. It's notable that 22H2's end-of-support date is coming up very soon and it's only just been made available for all eligible Windows 11 devices. This slightly older version of Windows had its own fair share of issues that Microsoft had to address, and this is possibly why it's taken this long for Microsoft to expand its availability to all eligible users.", "source": {"uri": "techradar.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "TechRadar"}, "authors": [{"uri": "kristina_terech@techradar.com", "name": "Kristina Terech", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}], "image": "https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/6dzurcbnjMdza8CXZM9XXe-1200-80.jpg", "eventUri": "eng-9736998", "sentiment": 0.05098039215686279, "wgt": 459007184, "relevance": 13}

{"url": "https://www.economy.pk/microsoft-launches-canva-rival-for-phones-and-pc/", "title": "Microsoft Launches Canva Rival for Phones and PC - Economy.pk", "body": "Microsoft has officially unveiled its AI-powered image creation tool, Designer, following an extensive testing period. The platform is now publicly accessible to anyone with a Microsoft account, offering robust capabilities across multiple devices and languages.\n\nDesigner is designed to cater to a broad spectrum of users, from novices to experienced creatives. For beginners, the platform provides pre-designed templates that can be used to create greeting cards, phone wallpapers, profile pictures, and more. These templates offer a straightforward way to produce professional-looking designs without needing advanced skills. For more skilled users, Designer offers the flexibility to craft templates and build unique artwork from scratch, allowing for complete creative control. This versatility ensures that users can either start from scratch or refine existing images to suit their specific needs.\n\nOne of Designer's standout features is its availability across various devices and platforms. Users can access the tool via web browsers in over 80 languages, ensuring a wide reach. Additionally, mobile apps for both iOS and Android platforms provide on-the-go access, while a dedicated Windows application caters to desktop users. This multi-device accessibility ensures that users can work on their projects anytime, anywhere, making it a convenient option for busy creatives.\n\nMicrosoft has seamlessly integrated Designer with its other AI offerings, particularly the Copilot AI chatbot. This integration allows users to effortlessly incorporate Designer-generated images into Microsoft Word and PowerPoint documents. However, to fully utilize this feature, a Copilot Pro subscription is required. This strategic integration enhances the overall user experience, making it easier to create and manage content across Microsoft's suite of tools.\n\nFor those familiar with Canva, Designer's interface will feel instantly recognizable. Both platforms share a user-friendly approach, making it easy for users to transition between them. Designer leverages OpenAI's powerful image generator, DALL-E, which is also integrated into Copilot's use of DALL-E 3 and ChatGPT 4 Turbo. This alignment with cutting-edge AI technologies ensures that users have access to advanced tools for their creative projects.\n\nMicrosoft's launch of Designer marks a significant entry into the competitive field of digital design tools, positioning itself as a strong rival to Canva. With its versatile capabilities, multi-device accessibility, and seamless integration within the Microsoft ecosystem, Designer is set to become a valuable tool for both novice and experienced creatives. Whether you're looking to create simple designs or intricate artwork, Designer provides the tools and flexibility needed to bring your creative visions to life.", "source": {"uri": "economy.pk", "dataType": "news", "title": "Economy.pk"}, "authors": [], "image": "https://www.economy.pk/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/article-canva.jpg", "eventUri": "eng-9740942", "sentiment": 0.2392156862745098, "wgt": 459007031, "relevance": 13}

{"url": "https://distrowatch.com/dwres.php?resource=showheadline&story=18415", "title": "SUSE gaining ground in the enterprise market, asks openSUSE to rebrand", "body": "SUSE gaining ground in the enterprise market, asks openSUSE to rebrand FOSS Force recently ran an article which suggested SUSE is starting to replace Red Hat as the standard bearer for enterprise Linux. In part this is due to Red Hat's mishandling of CentOS and SUSE's willingness to not only support its own products for longer periods of time, but to also support Red Hat's former products past their normal end of life dates. This gives SUSE an air of stability and predictability. However, at the same time, not everything is running smoothly in the SUSE and openSUSE communities. SUSE has apparently asked openSUSE to change its name (again) and there are concerns openSUSE doesn't currently have the goverance in place to effectively manage its own project. The issues are being discussed in a mailing list thread. \"Let me first define a couple of things that the community is being faced with: Our current governance is not working. With the things we're facing and the current model / Board rules, there is no good way the Board could drive the resulting changes coming up. Bi-weekly meetings will definitely not be enough. Furthermore, the Board has not shown any real proactive leadership in some situations where it should have. In the end, the reason I stepped down from it.\n\nWhether we like it or not, we have to rebrand the Project. We can start working on it now and be proactive, or later be forced by f.e. some new owner of SUSE ( mind, SUSE has expressed their concern about such a thing happening and clearly stated that they do not want to get rid of the Project). To drive this we need something else than the Board as it is now. But keeping things as they are simply is an unrealistic option.\"", "source": {"uri": "distrowatch.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "DistroWatch"}, "authors": [], "image": null, "eventUri": null, "sentiment": 0.1372549019607843, "wgt": 459006987, "relevance": 26}

Este tÃ­tulo, por ejemplo, ofrece una extraordinaria aventura que se extiende alrededor de unas 30 horas de media, y no supondrÃ­a esfuerzo alguno jugarlo a lo largo de un mes.\n\nPuedes acceder a esta lista de juegos en PlayStation 5 a travÃ©s de: PlayStation Plus > Colecciones > Ãšltima oportunidad para jugar.\n\nEl esperado nuevo capÃ­tulo de la serie JRPG estarÃ¡ disponible a partir del 29 de agosto en PC con Windows, PlayStation y Xbox Series. Se trata de primer capÃ­tulo de estreno dentro de la serie principal en mÃ¡s de 15 aÃ±os, algo que ya supone todo un acontecimiento para los seguidores de la franquicia.\n\nEl tÃ­tulo narra la historia de Val, que acaba de ser nombrado custodio de Ã¡nimas y debe acompaÃ±ar a Hina, su amiga de la infancia, hasta el Ãrbol de Mana. {"url": "https://securityboulevard.com/?p=2024758", "title": "ESET: Chinese Adware Opens Windows Systems to More Threats", "body": "Malware aimed at Chinese-speaking people that passed itself off as a tool for improving the web browsing experience by blocking ads and malicious websites not only changed the content of a requested page or steered users to another one but also collected system information and allowed other bad actors to escalate privileges and run malicious code in Windows systems.\n\nResearchers with cybersecurity firm ESET noted that most security products detected the embedded HotPage installer - which was signed by Microsoft - as adware, but that a look under the hood revealed more sinister capabilities.\n\nThe malware illustrates the lengths to which bad actors will go to slip their malicious code into systems and some of the inherent weaknesses in security models, according to Romain Dumont, malware researcher at ESET.\n\n\"The HotPage driver reminds us that abusing Extended Verification certificates is still a thing,\" Dumont wrote in a report Thursday. \"As a lot of security models are at some point based on trust; threat actors are inclined to play along the line between legitimate and shady. Whether such software is advertised as a security solution or simply bundled with other software, the capabilities granted thanks to this trust expose users to security risks.\"\n\nESET at the end of 2023 came across the HotPage malware, which was being detected by security products as adware. However, researchers looked into the embedded driver that had been signed by Microsoft, finding it was developed by a Chinese company called Hubei Dunwang Network Technology Co., an organization they could find little information about.\n\nThe software was advertised as an \"internet cafÃ© security solution\" for Chinese-speaking individuals and claiming to block ads and dangerous websites. What the researchers found was a dangerous piece of multi-faceted malware.\n\n\"On top of its obvious mischievous behavior, this kernel component unintentionally leaves the door open for other threats to run code at the highest privilege level available in the Windows operating system: the SYSTEM account,\" Dumont wrote. \"Due to improper access restrictions to this kernel component, any processes can communicate with it and leverage its code injection capability to target any non-protected processes.\"\n\nESET reported the driver to Microsoft March 18 and the driver was removed from the Windows Server Catalog May 1.\n\nWhen executed the HotPage malware loads the driver onto Windows, a process that since the 64-bit version of Windows 7 has required a signature from Microsoft. The security and compatibility process is built on trust and has been abused, he wrote. The Chinese company went through the steps and obtained an Extended Verification certificate.\n\nThe company submitted its drivers under various product categories and appears to have developed two network filtering programs - a netfilter and the HotPage driver, which is referred to as adsafe. Investigating the Chinese company online, the researchers only found that it was created in January 2022, had an email address, and offered tech-related activities like development, services, and consulting, as well as advertising functions. Its primary shareholder is a small Chinese ad and marketing company. A website was created in February 2022 and a couple of months later the company applied for the trade name Shield Internet CafÃ© Security Defense.\n\nIt's still unclear how the HotPage malware is distributed, though it may come bundled with another software package or advertised as a security product.\n\n\"The installer drops the driver on disk and starts a service to execute it,\" Dumont wrote. \"It decrypts its configuration file, which contains a list of target Chromium-based browsers and libraries. If such executables are found running or being loaded, the driver tries to inject one of the listed libraries into the browser process. After hooking network-based Windows API functions, the injected library checks the URL being accessed and under certain conditions, it displays another page to the user through diverse means.\"\n\nThe installer comes as a UPX-compressed file and includes the encrypted versions of the driver, libraries that will be injected into the browser processes and three JSON-formatted configuration files that contain targeted browsers and libraries, filtering rules, an API endpoint for sending details about the system and another for managing configuration updates.\n\nThe malware checks to see if it's running in a virtualized environment, decrypts the driver, creates a name followed by the .sys extension, and then a service to load the driver. It targets endpoints, collects information like the computer name, network interface MAC address, version of the operating system, and screen dimensions, then sends the information to a remote server through a HTTP POST request.\n\nThe driver injects libraries via the open source Blackbone Project into browser applications and alters their execution flow to change the URL being accessed by the user or opens a page in a new tab. Notification routine are set to monitor newly created processes and executable images that are downloaded.\n\nThe ESET researchers developed a proof-of-concept Python script that proved two scenarios where individuals could be allowed to escalate their privileges through the HotPage driver to run code as the NT AUTHORITY/Systems. One involved using arbitrary DLL injection in arbitrary processes, the other changing the command line of newly created processes.\n\nThe adware itself can be annoying, Dumont wrote, adding that the malware delivers more dangerous threats by allowing an attacker with a non-privileged account to use the driver to obtain SYSTEM privileges or introduced libraries into remote processes, causing further damage.\n\n\"The analysis of this rather generic-looking piece of malware has proven, once again, that adware developers are still willing to go the extra mile to achieve their goals,\" he wrote. \"Not only that, these have developed a kernel component with a large set of techniques to manipulate processes, but they also went through the requirements imposed by Microsoft to obtain a code-signing certificate for their driver component.\"", "source": {"uri": "securityboulevard.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Security Boulevard"}, "authors": [{"uri": "jeffrey_burt@securityboulevard.com", "name": "Jeffrey Burt", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}], "image": "https://securityboulevard.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/canstockphoto14662879.jpg", "eventUri": null, "sentiment": -0.02745098039215688, "wgt": 459006852, "relevance": 50}

{"url": "https://finbold.com/analysts-revise-microsoft-stock-price-target-2/", "title": "Analysts revise Microsoft stock price target", "body": "A recent drawback in large-cap tech stocks didn't exclude Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT) stock, which retraced by 4.23% in the previous five trading sessions. However, it has already managed to reclaim some of the losses, as it has pre-market gains of 0.58% at the time of writing.\n\nDespite a recent rotation from large-cap to small-cap stocks, experts see MSFT stock as one of the best picks for investors due to strong fundamentals, extensive market share, and growth prospects.\n\nThe tech giant's backing from Wall Street analysts is best evidenced by the recent price targets it received from notable institutions ahead of its Q2 earnings report on July 30.\n\nIn the most recent price target release on July 18, TD Cowen has maintained a positive outlook on Microsoft shares, raising the price target from $470 to $495 and reiterating a \"buy\" rating. The firm's analysis highlights consistent performance in Microsoft's Office 365 Commercial segment, forecasting a 14% growth in constant currency (cc).\n\nDespite a 15% cc growth in the previous quarter, TD Cowen expects Microsoft to have an in-line quarter, with vendor consolidation and Average Revenue Per User (ARPU) growth through upgrades as beneficial factors.\n\nA day before, on July 17, Bank of America raised its price target for MSFT to $510 from $480, citing strong performance in Azure cloud services and early success with the Copilot feature.\n\nAnalysts noted that Microsoft partners are performing well, with most tracking above or in line with expectations ahead of Q2 FY24 results on July 30. They forecast a 31.5% year-over-year growth for Azure, driven by an 8% contribution from AI workloads, surpassing the initial estimate of 30.5%.\n\nOn the same date, Citi reaffirmed its positive outlook on Windows maker by maintaining a \"buy\" rating and a $520 price target. Anticipation is building for Microsoft's upcoming second-quarter results, with solid expectations for both revenue and earnings.\n\nDespite the 11% share increase since the last earnings report, Citi believes the forthcoming results will showcase the company's sustained growth, even if they are not a significant catalyst.\n\nJuly 16 saw Mizuho Securities update its outlook on Microsoft stock, raising the price target to $480 from $450 and maintaining an \"outperform\" rating. This adjustment comes after Microsoft's fiscal third-quarter earnings report, which showed total revenue of $61.9 billion, exceeding analysts' forecast of $60.8 billion.\n\nWith a \"strong buy\" consensus from 35 analysts and an average price target of $504.12, reflecting a 13.66% upside, MSFT shares remain one of the Wall Street analysts' favorite holdings.\n\nBuy stocks now with eToro - trusted and advanced investment platform", "source": {"uri": "finbold.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Finbold"}, "authors": [{"uri": "elmaz_sabovic@finbold.com", "name": "Elmaz Sabovic", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}], "image": "https://assets.finbold.com/uploads/2024/07/Analysts-revise-Microsoft-stock-price-target.jpg", "eventUri": "eng-9743842", "sentiment": 0.5137254901960784, "wgt": 459006596, "relevance": 1}

{"url": "https://www.makeuseof.com/nzxt-function2-minitkl-review/", "title": "This Keyboard Was a Great Introduction to Customization With Plenty of Color Variations", "body": "Key Takeaways The compact NZXT Function 2 MiniTKL keyboard offers customization with per-key RGB lighting, which is ideal for gamers on the go. The required wired connection and Windows-only support may limit appeal to some users seeking more versatility. Durable design, variety of color options, and customization possibilities make it a solid entry-level gaming keyboard.\n\nThe NZXT Function 2 MiniTKL keyboard provides a fine balance of entry-level customization and well-lit per-key RGB lighting. For those after a compact gaming experience, this optical gaming keyboard is designed to be long-lasting with a light footprint for your on-the-go uses and personal desk space.\n\nAs a trade-off for its customization, a required wired connection and stricter Windows software support may make it less ideal for some.\n\nNZXT Function 2 MiniTKL Keyboard 8/ 10 $90 $130 Save $40\n\nThe NZXT Function 2 MiniTKL wired compact keyboard offers a long-lasting gaming experience with an aerospace-grade aluminum top plate and doubleshot PBT keycaps that resist fading over time. Beyond a small, lightweight footprint, per-key RGB, 2-level height adjustment, and hot-swappable switches allow for a fully custom, learning experience to enhance your gaming and everyday use.\n\nProsThe smaller size makes it more travel-friendlyLeft hand volume roller and shortcut buttons offer improved easeSoftware is easy to useFour on-board profiles for easy color sharing between devicesGlobal switch actuation and adjustable polling rate ConsNot everyone will be a fan of the wired connectionNZXT Cam software requires Windows 10 or later with no planned Mac or Linux supportNo included wrist restRaised keys may show dirt or hair more $130 at NZXT$90 at Amazon How We Test and Review Products Price and Availability\n\nThe NZXT Function 2 MiniTKL keyboard is available to purchase from Amazon or the NZXT website. The matte black and white versions can be picked up for a base price of $129.99 for the tenkeyless optical gaming keyboard.\n\nSpecifications\n\nBrand NZXT Wireless No, detachable wired Backlight Per-Key RGB Media Controls Yes Switch Type NZXT Swift Linear Optical Switch Compatible Devices Windows, Mac, Xbox, Playstation Wired operation Braided USB-C to USB-A Dimensions 1.59 x 13.36 x 4.86 inches Material 5000 Series Aluminum Bluetooth No Charging Wired Keycaps Doubleshot Shine-Through PBT Internal Sound Dampening Dual-layer foam and tape-enhanced PCB Wrist rest No Polling rate Up to 8,000 Hz Layout US QWERTY / ANSI Memory On-board Expand Unboxing the Compact Keyboard Experience\n\nOut of the box, the smaller Function 2 MiniTKL keyboard offers the number of keys typical for a TKL keyboard (87), some shortcut buttons, and a volume wheel at the side for ease of use. With its wired connection, it can support a max polling rate of 8000 Hz. To not detract from the per-key RGB colors, media shortcut keys are discrete, along with the numbered F-keys for quick swapping between profiles.\n\nAs a note, the keyboard is a US QWERTY / ANSI type, so if you pair it with a device that can't detect it, you'll want to identify it as such for proper operation. But once you've plugged in via the included detachable cable, the 0.2 ms response time will read each stroke readily, especially with the default actuation rate.\n\nGaming and Everyday Keyboard Usage\n\nAs a compact keyboard, the Function 2 MiniTKL is light and more inviting for travel. The wired connection is a removable braided USB-C to USB-A, so if you're packing it, you can separate the two as needed. The three-level height adjustment and the five-point rubbering at the rear also accommodate a variety of surfaces, so you can easily adjust to your preferred needs.\n\nAs a trade-off, no wrist rest is included, so you'll have to purchase your own or spring for the fuller-sized NZXT Function 2 keyboard at a slight price uptick.\n\nWith its aluminum top plate and the doubleshot PBT keycaps, this keyboard is designed to last 100 million key presses. The Default pre-lubed switches and stabilizers have a light but consistent feel to each press with a minor bit of auditory feedback. Lighting is distributed well, and the font of the keycaps is well displayed, even with darker font types.\n\nIn everyday testing, the smaller footprint does make it good for places where a smaller set of shortcut keys is welcome. When working with the XP-Pen Magic Drawing Pad tablet and Krita, default and quick key remapping allowed for placement on either side of the tablet while drawing and editing. When working in full-screen mode, the option to disable an accidental press of the Windows key or swipe to adjust volume via the left-side wheel keeps you focused on the task at hand.\n\nAn adjustable actuation level and polling rate can further enhance the base gaming experience. While the degree of notice will depend on the user and game type, it's a welcome option, especially for those looking for more competitive gaming bonuses.\n\nUsing the NZXT Cam Software\n\nWhen considering any newer NZXT keyboard, you'll want to first make sure you can use the NZXT Cam software for full customization. While the keyboard allows brightness control via a button, if you're after a custom profile and control of the per-key RGB lighting, you'll need to access the software.\n\nPresently, there's no planned support for macOS or Linux, so you'll need Windows 10 or beyond since there's no official option for legacy versions of the Cam software. But if you meet the Windows operating system requirement, the Cam software can manage multiple aspects of your system experience with multiple NZXT devices.\n\nIf you're just starting with a keyboard, the software allows you to keep your involvement as minimal or detailed as desired. For many, the main experiment will be choosing between an assortment of color mode customization options that are either a base or reactive effect. For those unfamiliar with more specialized terminology, the software provides a quick explanation of typically unfamiliar items.\n\nFour different onboard profiles can be switched between via the Fn key, allowing for a quick switch between different colors, macro keys, and remapped keys.\n\nSwapping and Customizing With Included Tools and Switches\n\nWhen purchasing a custom keyboard for gaming use, not all allow for easy modification. While many may include at least a keycap puller, the NZXT Function 2 MiniTKL includes both a keycap and switch puller, four 35g yellow linear optical switches, and four 45g red linear optical switches to trade-out.\n\nFor those new to or nervous about changing out switches for gaming, the subtle difference allows for a bit of experimentation when combined with the other setting tweaks without a separate purchase.\n\nThe keyboard manual also walks you through the process and placement if you're unsure about how to use the tools or fear bending a component. Once you've figured it out, it's a very quick process, so you're free to change out and experiment with the different switches around your preferred keys to prevent any accidental presses.\n\nShould You Buy the NZXT Function 2 MiniTKL Keyboard?\n\nThe NZXT Function 2 MiniTKL keyboard offers numerous customization options with a few minor omissions that come as a result of its smaller desktop footprint. If you're a Windows or multi-system user, you'll get the most out of the keyboard; you'll find yourself left out from the major color customizations if you're strictly using non-Windows systems.\n\nOverall, if you're looking for a keyboard that comes at a reasonable price and can introduce you to the major aspects of a customizable gaming keyboard without additional cost, the MiniTKL does a great job. Plus, if you're looking for a keyboard for travel gaming or a lighter weight, it can tuck away easily without worrying about charging it. For all its strengths, it's a great fit for the right setting.\n\nNZXT Function 2 MiniTKL Keyboard 8/ 10 $90 $130 Save $40\n\nThe NZXT Function 2 MiniTKL wired compact keyboard offers a long-lasting gaming experience with an aerospace-grade aluminum top plate and doubleshot PBT keycaps that resist fading over time. Beyond a small, lightweight footprint, per-key RGB, 2-level height adjustment, and hot-swappable switches allow for a fully custom, learning experience to enhance your gaming and everyday use.\n\n$130 at NZXT$90 at Amazon", "source": {"uri": "makeuseof.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "MakeUseOf"}, "authors": [], "image": "https://static1.makeuseofimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/wm/2024/06/nzxtfunction2minitklkeyboard_featuredimage.jpg", "eventUri": null, "sentiment": 0.419607843137255, "wgt": 459006395, "relevance": 63}

{"url": "https://www.techradar.com/pro/owc-express-1m2-2tb-review", "title": "OWC Express 1M2 2TB review", "body": "The OWC Express 1M2 is quite unique in the field of best external hard drives for several reasons. The first is that its available as an enclosure or as a ready-to-go storage solution, with a choice of capacities from 1 to 8TB. Then there's the look and styling that has been created to ensure that the drive inside remains cool, however demanding a task you have the drive working through. Those tasks can be anything from processing a range of spreadsheets or, more likely, being the hub of a video production or photoshoot.\n\nThe aluminium outer casing has essentially been built as one large heat sink to ensure that even after hours of continued use, the drive remains fast and that any effects of thermal throttling are kept to a minimum. The design also means that there are no fans, so the drive runs nice and silent, no matter the load. The drive also incorporates the latest connection technology and offers transfer rates of up to 3151MB/s in real-world tests; this is well beyond the scope of most portable hard drives. Usually, these speeds are only reached by internal drives or dedicated working external systems.\n\nAs with other OWC drives, the setup process is easy and essentially involves a plug-and-play approach with a single cable that connects the drive to the computer, providing both power and data transfer. The connection type is USB-C (40Gb/s), which is one of the fastest connections out there and will enable the smooth data transfers needed for 4 and 8-K video editing.\n\nWhile the drive comes APFS formatted, you do have the option to use the OWC Drive Guide (Mac) software that's included on the drive to change the format to an older Mac file system or ExFat for cross-compatibility with Windows. As the drive is Mac formatted, it won't initially be viewable or accessible on a PC; however, the drive can be formatted in that ExFat format using the OWC Drive Guide (Mac) on a Mac, or you can download the trial of the OWC MacDrive software to access the disk and format it to the correct file format for use.\n\nWhen it comes to size the drive is slightly larger than most of the best portable SSDs we've tested; however, with the performance that it offers, that's not an issue, and while it may be a touch larger, it's still relatively lightweight. Using the drive for editing 4K video on Final Cut Pro X, the speed and ease of use is seamless with no reliability issues, with the drive providing the performance that you would usually expect from an internal SSD.\n\nThe OWC Express 1M2 is a premium price for its capacity, but this is balanced by the build quality and performance, which is pretty much unmatched in the market. It's available directly from OWC's website and through various authorised retailers. Prices vary depending on the storage capacity chosen, with options ranging up to 8TB. The drive includes a three-year warranty for the complete solution or two years for the enclosure.\n\nA glance at the OWC Express 1M2, and you could easily mistake it for a huge heat sink, with its full aluminium build and gill-like design that helps to dissipate the heat. The Aluminium used is of aircraft-grade quality and, therefore, provides strength and protection around the internal SSD even when thrown in a kit back with little to no other protection. In our review sample, which is at the lower end of the capacity options, there's fitted a 2TB SSD, but there are other options at 1, 2, 4, or 8TB. The design of the drive also means that it's available with a drive installed or empty.\n\nWhile the drive's full metal build gives it a strong and robust design and feel, measuring 23mm (0.9 in), length 132 mm (5.2 in), and width 70 mm (2.8 in), it does feel relatively light at 253.0 g (0.56 lbs) and this helps to ensure that it remains highly portable.\n\nOn the base are two long rubber pads that help it to stay in position, which can be useful when working out in the field, and surface space is often at a premium. Under one of these feet are the screws that enable you to replace the SSD with a larger capacity if you require it in the future.\n\nOn the back is the USB Type-C port. This is a USB4, up to 40 Gb/s (or 5000 MB/s), which is far in excess of most standard portable SSDs and further highlights that this drive is focused towards high-demand applications such as video, audio, and photography.\n\nInside the box, along with the drive, is a USB-C cable. While the drive is USB 4, it is fully backwards compatible with any compatible connector, although the maximum transfer speeds will vary depending on the device.\n\nThe OWC Express 1M2 is a portable SSD design with ultra-fast performance and reliability at its heart, and as such, it is able to reach up to 3151MB/s, as quoted by OWC, in real-world scenarios. This speed should ensure that larger files, projects, and applications can be handled smoothly with a performance that is similar, if not the same, to that of your internal SSD. This will make it an ideal solution for video editing as well as any other task that requires a large amount of data to be accessed, written to, or moved at speed.\n\nOur review sample arrived pre-configured with 2TB storage, which is one of OWC's superb NVMe Aura SSDs. However, you can also build your drive to your specifications with support for various NVMe M.2 SSD sizes (2230, 2242, and 2280).\n\nWhile most high-demand applications have traditionally been confined to the Studio or Office, the speed and performance of the USB4, Thunderbolt, and USB-C connections allow most equipped laptops to make the most of the capacity and speed out in the field. With the drive's BUS-powered connection, only one cable is needed for both power and data making it an easy solution for use out in the field.\n\nAs the drive has been designed to be portable at a professional level, the outer casing made from aircraft-grade Aluminium serves a dual purpose. It offers rugged protection for the SSD while maintaining silence, and the metal design also acts as an effective cooling system that will help sustain top speeds.\n\nFinally, the drive is backed by a three-year warranty or a two-year warranty for the enclosure.\n\nGetting started with the OWC Express 1M2 is easy enough with the plug-and-play nature when used on Mac systems, meaning that it's ready to go. However, the onboard \"OWC Drive Guide (Mac)\" recommends fresh formatting provided by the software, and this enables you to select from four options: to stay with APFS, use the older HFS, go for ExFat for cross-compatibility with PCs, or to do it manually.\n\nIn this test, we started with the APFS option and then used Disk Utility to reformat the drive in the ExFat for use on your PC. If you're a PC user, you will need a Mac to reformat the drive to a PC-recognisable format. Alternatively, you can use the OWC MacDrive software trial to help you get started. This software essentially enables you to see Mac Drive on a PC and is very useful if you're used to using both systems\n\nWhen it came to the benchmark tests, the OWC Express 1M2 delivers exceptional performance, making it ideal for various professional and creative tasks. With read speeds of 3002MB/s and write speeds of 2994MB/s in AJA System Test Lite, it handles large file transfers and data-intensive tasks with ease. ATTO results show even higher read speeds of 3130MB/s and write speeds of 3200MB/s, confirming its capability for high-speed data processing. The AmorphousDiskMark scores, with read speeds of 3203.26MB/s and write speeds of 2608.04MB/s, further highlight its suitability for demanding applications such as Final Cut Pro X and DaVinci Resolve.\n\nFor creative professionals, the Express 1M2 is well-suited for tasks such as video editing, where the high read and write speeds are essential to ensure smooth playback and quick rendering of 4K and higher resolution video if you're a photographer. The ability to handle large RAW file transfers and quick access times is ideal for backup and fast access and saves when using Photoshop. Audio professionals will also appreciate the fast data access and transfer rates for managing large audio files and multitrack sessions.\n\nIn an office setting, the 1M2'sss 1M2's high-speed performance, while nice to have, could be seen as a little overkill. File transfers and data backups are faster, but in reality, there are far cheaper solutions out there that will do the job at the speed you need.\n\nOverall, the OWC 1M2'sss 1M2's benchmarks are impressive and highlight that it is an excellent choice for creative users who need reliable and fast portable storage for video, audio, and photography.\n\nThe OWC Express 1M2 is a superb portable SSD, offering some of the fastest transfer rates for this size of drive on the market. Not only that, but the build quality is superb. This impressive speed and rugged build make it a perfect choice for professionals and creatives who require reliable, high-performance storage on the go. The higher price point is justified by its quality and features, making it a worthwhile investment, but for office users, this builds quality, and performance could be a lot better.", "source": {"uri": "techradar.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "TechRadar"}, "authors": [{"uri": "alastair_jennings@techradar.com", "name": "Alastair Jennings", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}], "image": "https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/Z49bGDc78aSoaHu2M2jnw3-1200-80.jpg", "eventUri": null, "sentiment": 0.2862745098039217, "wgt": 459006322, "relevance": 26}
{"url": "https://www.theregister.com/2024/07/18/russias_fin7_is_peddling_its/", "title": "FIN7 is peddling its EDR-nerfing malware to ransomware gangs", "body": "Prolific Russian cybercrime syndicate FIN7 is using various pseudonyms to sell its custom security solution-disabling malware to different ransomware gangs.\n\nAvNeutralizer malware was previously thought to be solely linked to the Black Basta group, but fresh research has uncovered various underground forum listings of the malicious software now believed to be created by FIN7 operatives.\n\nCybercriminals would specify the specific endpoint detection and response (EDR) solutions they wanted to bypass, and then a custom builder would be provided for them...\n\nPrices range between $4,000 and $15,000 and evidence suggests that AvNeutralizer has been marketed since at least 2022, with a surge in engagements involving FIN7's tool appearing in early 2023.\n\nSentinelOne's researchers said the malware is effective at disabling endpoint security products from its own portfolio and Windows Defender, as well as Sophos, Panda Security, Elastic, and Symantec.\n\nBlack Basta was spotted using AvNeutralizer a couple of years ago, but various other ransomware campaigns which started in 2023 began using the malware to evade detection too.\n\nCriminals using well-known ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) variants such as LockBit, ALPHV/BlackCat, Trigona, AvosLocker, and Medusa all showed they found value in AvNeutralizer, although concrete links between FIN7 and these RaaS operations haven't been firmly established.\n\nWhen purchasing the tool from what SentinelOne now believes to be pseudonyms adopted by FIN7, cybercriminals would specify the specific endpoint detection and response (EDR) solutions they wanted to bypass, and then a custom builder would be provided for them.\n\n\"Considering the available evidence and prior intelligence, we assess with high confidence that 'goodsoft,' 'lefroggy,' 'killerAV' and 'Stupor' [personas] belong to the FIN7 cluster,\" said Antonio Cocomazzi, staff offensive security researcher at SentinelOne, in a blog this week.\n\n\"Furthermore, these threat actors are likely employing multiple pseudonyms on various forums to mask their true identity and sustain their illicit operations within this network.\"\n\nAvNeutralizer is also under continuous development and has proven to be a mainstay of FIN7's arsenal of tools, which include backdoors, PowerShell scripts, and pentesting kits.\n\nThe most recent version, the earliest sighting of which was dated April 2023, introduced a novel tampering technique using ProcLaunchMon.sys, a built-in TTD monitor driver in Windows, to create a denial of service condition in specific processes.\n\nThe full details of how FIN7 crashes EDR solutions are detailed in SentinelOne's blog but in essence, it suspends the child processes of targeted protected processes. The latter then fails because they can no longer communicate with the former.\n\nIt should also be said that this isn't a catch-all method to kill EDR processes - more than ten other user mode and kernel mode techniques are used to bust top security solutions. These are all well-documented already, though.\n\nSentinelOne said that now it has a clearer understanding of AvNeutralizer, how it is marketed and who is using it, the team is able to track malicious activity more accurately and carry out better-informed retrospective analyses.\n\nFIN7 has been in play since 2012 and over the past 12 years it has continually evolved tactics from the early days of deploying point-of-sale (PoS) card-stealing malware to becoming a fully fledged ransomware gang in 2020.\n\nAt times it has been affiliated with the likes of REvil and Conti, but also went on to form its own RaaS operation in the form of Darkside, which later rebranded to BlackMatter after it hit Colonial Pipeline.\n\nWhen its members weren't trying to conceal themselves behind an array of pseudonyms, they were creating fake companies, such as Combi Security and Bastion Secure, to conceal their actions and hire unwitting IT professionals to help them set up ransomware attacks. It didn't work out too well for some of them.\n\nDespite the numerous arrests of FIN7 members over the years, the group strides on to this day and continues to evolve, making the task of attribution that more important.\n\n\"FIN7's continuous innovation, particularly in its sophisticated techniques for evading security measures, showcases its technical expertise,\" said Cocomazzi.\n\n\"The group's use of multiple pseudonyms and collaboration with other cybercriminal entities makes attribution more challenging and demonstrates its advanced operational strategies. We hope this research will inspire further efforts to understand and mitigate FIN7's evolving tactics.\" Â®", "source": {"uri": "theregister.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "theregister.com"}, "authors": [], "image": "https://regmedia.co.uk/2017/10/20/security_shutterstock.jpg", "eventUri": "eng-9744044", "sentiment": 0.2470588235294118, "wgt": 459006228, "relevance": 26}

{"url": "https://www.kommersant.ru/doc/6838026", "title": "Microsoft Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Designer Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ³ĞµĞ½ĞµÑ€Ğ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¸ ĞºĞ°Ñ€Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¾Ğº Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ñ‚ĞµĞºÑÑ‚Ñƒ", "body": "ĞĞ¼ĞµÑ€Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ğ½ÑĞºĞ°Ñ ĞºĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ñ Microsoft Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¿ÑƒÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Designer, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»ÑĞµÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ñ‚ĞµĞºÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¸ÑĞ°Ğ½Ğ¸ÑĞ¼ ÑĞ¾Ğ·Ğ´Ğ°Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ½Ñ‹. Amazon confirmed last month that new deals may surface as often as every five minutes on the site. {"url": "https://www.itespresso.fr/windows-11-microsoft-va-reduire-la-taille-des-mises-a-jour-275243.html", "title": "Windows 11 : comment Microsoft va rÃ©duire la taille des mises Ã  jour | ITespresso.fr", "body": "Comment rÃ©duire la taille des mises Ã  jour de Windows 11 ? En introduisant des checkpoints.\n\nMicrosoft compte mettre cette approche en Å“uvre d'ici Ã  la fin de l'annÃ©e. Il en donne un aperÃ§u sur le canal Dev (build 26210.1252)*.\n\nÃ€ l'heure actuelle, les mises Ã  jour mensuelles dites \" de qualitÃ© \" (diffusÃ©es lors Patch Tuesday) sont construites de faÃ§on cumulative Ã  partir de la RTM du systÃ¨me d'exploitation : chacune inclut tous les changements intervenus depuis lors.\n\nLes mises Ã  jour \" checkpoint \" se fonderont non pas sur la RTM, mais sur le prÃ©cÃ©dent checkpoint.
